Package http.server

Class WebServer

java.lang.Object
http.server.WebServer
public class WebServer
extends java.lang.Object
HTTP server implementing GET, PUT, POST, DELETE and HEAD requests
Author:
GALERZA Javier, BEL Corentin, KERMANI Benjamin

  • Method Details

    • start

      protected void start​(int port)
      WebServer constructor
      Parameters:
      port - port number on which ServerSocket will be created

    • buildResponseHeader

      protected java.lang.String buildResponseHeader​(java.lang.String status, java.lang.String message)
      Build simple response header that will be returned to client
      Parameters:
      status - HTTP code status
      message - message explaining HTTP code status
      Returns:
      response header as string

    • buildResponseHeader

      protected java.lang.String buildResponseHeader​(java.lang.String status, java.lang.String message, java.lang.String filename, long length)
      Build complex response header that will be returned to client, allowing him to interpret response depending on content-type
      Parameters:
      status - HTTP code status
      message - message explaining HTTP code status
      filename - filename to find corresponding extension (file type)
      length - file length (in bytes)
      Returns:
      response header as string

    • httpGET

      protected void httpGET​(java.io.BufferedOutputStream out, java.lang.String filename)
      HTTP method that returns resource to client, allowing him to visualize the resource he asked for. ( filename doesn't exist : 404 Not found otherwise : 200 OK exception : 500 Internal error
      Parameters:
      out - output flux to client socket
      filename - filepath

    • httpPUT

      protected void httpPUT​(java.io.BufferedInputStream in, java.io.BufferedOutputStream out, java.lang.String filename)
      HTTP method that creates a resource (or replace an existing one). If file doesn't exist, creates it using data from request's body message. If file is old, replaces it (i.e, erase previous data) using data from request's body message. File is old : 200, OK File is new : 201, Created exception : 500, Internal error
      Parameters:
      in - client socket input stream, to read body message
      out - client socket output stream, to write response
      filename - filepath

    • httpPOST

      protected void httpPOST​(java.io.BufferedInputStream in, java.io.BufferedOutputStream out, java.lang.String filename)
      HTTP method that replaces an existing resource (or creates one ) If file exists : append at the end of file's data request's body message : 200, OK If file doesn't exist: creates a new file : 201, Created exception : 500, Internal error
      Parameters:
      in - client socket input stream, to read body message
      out - client socket output stream, to write response
      filename - filepath

    • httpDELETE

      protected void httpDELETE​(java.io.BufferedOutputStream out, java.lang.String filename)
      HTTP method that deletes a file given its filepath. If deleted : 204, No Content If can't delete : 403, Forbidden If not found : 404, Not Found exception : 500, Internal error
      Parameters:
      out - client socket output stream, to return header
      filename - filepath

    • httpHEAD

      protected void httpHEAD​(java.io.BufferedOutputStream out, java.lang.String filename)
      HTTP method returns headers that would be returned if specified resource was requested with HTTP GET.
      Parameters:
      out - client socket output flux, to send header
      filename - filepath

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Start the application.
      Parameters:
      args - port number
